publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-887# Shona Robison: Attack on Free Personal Care Policy-That the Parliament deplores the attack on the policy of free personal care by former Scottish Executive Minister, Sam Galbraith, and the offence caused to older people by his remarks; rejects the assertion that cancer services have suffered because of the decision to fund free personal care; is concerned about the negative impact his comments will have on both older people and cancer patients; is pleased that the policy of free personal care has helped to tackle some of the discrimination towards those with an age-related illness, and believes that this policy has been of huge benefit to many thousands of Scotland's elderly people and one of the most successful achievements of the Scottish Parliament.

S2M-887# Attack on Free Personal Care Policy (lodged on 9 February 2004) Christine Grahame*, Michael Matheson*, Tricia Marwick*, Mr Kenny MacAskill*, Nicola Sturgeon*, Fiona Hyslop*, Robin Harper*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Linda Fabiani*, Rob Gibson*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Brian Adam*, Patrick Harvie*, Bruce Crawford*, Richard Lochhead*, Alex Neil*, Ms Sandra White*, Jim Mather*
S2M-887# Attack on Free Personal Care Policy (lodged on 9 February 2004) Stewart Stevenson*, Eleanor Scott*, Dr Jean Turner*, Roseanna Cunningham*
